intro: Oldenlandia breviflora, commonly known as the dwarf spiderwort, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, Asia, and the Pacific. It is a member of the Commelinaceae family and typically grows as a herbaceous perennial. The plant features small, delicate flowers that are usually white or pale blue, with three petals and three sepals. Its leaves are opposite, lance-shaped, and often covered in fine hairs. Oldenlandia breviflora thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks.
